Author: coingirl87#6489
Content: Whats going on with barter dex? There is no volume since weeks...is the project dead?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Hi @Maha The fees distributing to holders of the DEX asset chain tokens. An average fee is ~0.15%

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
@coingirl87 We are currently working on marketmaker 2.0 (MM2.0) which is planned for Q1 2019. There will be new features and it will be more user-friendly ( e.g. 100% ordermatch, regardless of utxo state)
 + Mobile DEX planning on approximately Q2 2019. So it's not dead and actively developing at the moment.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it seems people dont want to use the DEX other than for testing and now the testing is not active,the DEX is not so active

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: I think more userfriendly software, marketing promotions and some market makers providing liquidity can solve this issue

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: a user friendly interface is already available. it's hyperdex. the problem is that it's not easy to make sell orders on hyperdex unless there is a counter order in the orderbook already. So noone is using it

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: the traditional barterdex which allowed you to make a sell and keep it there until the connection died or someone picked it up is to hard to use.

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: when a user can login, make a sell or buy order, walk away, and come back when it's fulfilled then we will see increased users. until then, we will only see weekend warriors.

Author: rainbro7#4735

Idk if its possible, just sounded like an interesting free marketing idea. I know there are other problems like liquidity, marketcap, etc... Just throwing things out there..
